targets.expr: sum by(uri) (rate(http_server_requests_seconds_sum{namespace='{{ .Release.Namespace }}',container='$container', uri!~'.*actuator.*|.*swagger.*|.*v3.*|.*providers.*', status='200'}[1m])) / sum by(uri) (rate(http_server_requests_seconds_count{namespace='{{ .Release.Namespace }}',container='$container', uri!~'.*actuator.*|.*swagger.*|.*v3.*|.*providers.*', status='200'}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Committed Eden (MB)
panels.description: Part of Garbage Collection. Eden space is a memory pool where new objects are created.

targets.expr: jvm_memory_committed_bytes{namespace='{{ .Release.Namespace }}',container='$container', area='heap', id='G1 Survivor Space', namespace='{{ .Release.Namespace }}'} / 1000000

panels.title: Committed Survivor (MB)
panels.description: Part of garbage collection. Survivor space is the memory pool in which when eden space is full, objects are moved to if they are still in use.

panels.title: Max Tenured (MB)
panels.description: Part of garbage collection. Tenured space is where long-lived objects are stored. Objects are moved here if they survive multiple garbage collection cycles within the survivor space. Garbage collection checks this space less often.
